ul.li: compatibility is only achieved between AIM and MIM schemas; entities defined in the ARMs may have different name and structure;
ISO 10303-214 formal rules have sometimes been renamed or splitted in several rules, located in various specific modules.

ext_description.note: This clause specifies rules that apply to the entity data types defined or imported through USE FROM statements. In some cases, these rules do not correspond to constraints specified in the ARM of the present module but reflect constraints specified in imported modules. For example, most of the dependent instantiable rules are related to the fact that in the modules where the constrained MIM entity is defined, the corresponding construct in the ARM is an attribute and not an entity. That is, in particular, the case for many role attributes. However, as the constrained MIM entity may be used in various modules and with various constraints, it is only at the level of the application protocol or of a conformance class that a formal rule applied to the MIM entity can be specified, synthesising the constraints applied to this MIM entity in all the imported modules.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A schema_name constant is an uppercase representation of the name of the present Express schema.

The approval_person_organization_requires_date_time rule specifies that each instance of shall be referenced by exactly one of either or where the assigned date or date and time specifies the sign off date of the approval.
This rule enforces the requirement for every approval, that, in case the approving or is specified, also the sign off date of the Approval has to be given.
There shall be exactly one instance of either or associated to an where the name of date role, respectively date time role, is 'sign off'.

The approval_requires_approval_assignment rule specifies that each instance of is referenced by at least one instance of as the .
This rule enforces the requirement for every approval to be applied at least once.
Each instance of shall be referenced at least once as the by an instance of .

The dimensionality_is_two_or_three rule ensures that all representations with a are defined in a two-dimensional or three-dimensional coordinate system.
Each shall have a equal to two or three.

The event_occurrence_requires_event_occurrence_assignment rule ensures that each instance of that serves not as a base for another instance of is referenced by at least one instance of as the .
This rule enforces the requirement for every event reference to be assigned to product data at least once.
Each that is not used as a by an instance of shall be used at least once as the of an instance of .
The global_length_and_angle_units_2d_or_3d rule ensures that units of length and plane angle are given for every .
Each shall have at least two elements in its set of units.
Each shall have exactly one and exactly one .

The externally_defined_class_with_known_source_requirement rule specifies that each instance of which references as the source a is contained in the set of items of exactly one applied_organization_assignment which references as its role an role with a name of 'class supplier'.

Each instance of which references as the source a shall be member in the set of items of an applied_organization_assignment. This organization assignment shall reference as its role an role with a name of 'class supplier'.
The restrict_name_for_known_source rule ensures that each instance of has a name of 'ISO 13584 library'.
Each instance of shall have a name of 'ISO 13584 library'.

The plib_class_reference_requires_version rule specifies that each instance of that has as its source a is contained in the set of items of exactly one which references as its role an identification role with a name of 'version'.
Each instance of that has as its source a is contained in the set of items of exactly one which references as its role an identification role with a name of 'version'.
An instance of that has as its source a may not be contained in the set of items of an which references as its role an identification role with a name of 'version'.

The person_requires_person_and_organization rule ensures that each instance of shall be referenced by at least one instance of as .
This rule enforces the requirement for each to have at least one specified the belongs to.
Each instance of shall be referenced by at least one instance of as .
The restrict_applied_event_occurrence_assignment rule ensures that each instance of that provides the context for an contains exactly one element in its set of items.
Each that has a role with a name of 'event context' shall contain exactly one element in its set of items.
The restrict_applied_organizational_project_assignment rule enforces the correct correlation between the types of items in the set of items of an and its associated object role.
If the role has a name of 'affecting project', only items of type shall be in the set of items.
If the role has a name of 'work program', only items of type 'executed action' shall be in the set of items.
The restrict_approval rule specifies the constraints that apply to an and to an in the context of this application module.
Each shall be referenced by at most two .
Each shall have an object role. This object role shall have a name of either 'actual' or 'planned'.
Each shall be referenced by at most one that has a name of 'actual'.
Each shall be referenced by at most one that has a name of 'planned'.
The restrict_class_system_assignment_for_approval_status rule specifies that each instance of shall be referenced by at most one instance of that specifies the classification system for the .
For each instance of there shall be only at most one instance of with a role name of 'class system membership'.
The restrict_class_system_assignment_for_class rule specifies that each instance of shall be referenced by at most one instance of that specifies the classification system for the .
For each instance of there shall be only at most one instance of with a role name of 'class system membership' that references that instance of .

The restrict_class_system_assignment_for_document_type rule specifies that each instance of shall be referenced by at most one instance of that specifies the classification system for the .

The restrict_class_system_assignment_for_planar_extent rule specifies that each instance of with a name of 'size format' shall be referenced by at most one instance of that specifies the referenced standard of the document format.
For each instance of with a name of 'size format' there shall be at most one instance of with a role name of 'class system membership'.

The restrict_class_system_assignment_for_security_classification_level rule specifies that each instance of shall be referenced by at most one instance of that specifies the classification system for the .
For each instance of there shall be only at most one instance of with a role name of 'class system membership'.
The restrict_configuration_design_for_specified_individual rule enforces the restrictions that apply to the usage of a when it relates to a configuration item which references as its item concept a .
Each instance of which has a name of 'physical instance basis' shall reference as design a which references as its a with a name of 'physical occurrence'.
Each instance of which has a name of 'physical instance basis' shall reference as configuration a configuration item of type .
The restrict_date_assignment rule constrains instances of when role name is 'actual end'.
For any instance of , if the role has a name of 'actual end', only items of type , or shall be in the set of items.
The restrict_document_reference rule constrains instances of applied_document_reference with role name 'general tolerance definition'.
For any instance of applied_document_reference, if the role has a name of 'general tolerance definition', only items of type shall be in the set of items.

For any instance of applied_document_reference, if the name of the role is not 'general tolerance definition', only items of type , , , class_system , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , shall be in the set of items.
The restrict_effectivity_assignment_for_class_category_usage rule restricts the usage of product_concept_feature_category_usage objects in an applied_effectivity_assignment .

An applied_effectivity_assignment which has a product_concept_feature_category_usage in its set of items may only have other product_concept_feature_category_usage objects in its set of items.
It shall have an which is not of an effectivity subtype and which has an id of 'class usage' and it shall be the of a class_usage_effectivity_context_assignment.
The restrict_effectivity_for_effectivity_relationship rule restricts the types of that may participate in an .
The and the of an may not be of type , , or .

The restrict_effectivity_usage rule enforces the usage of an that is not a or a by at least one instance of applied_effectivity_assignment or . An that is not a or a , shall either be used at least once as the by an with a name of 'inheritance', or it shall have an id of 'configuration validity' and be the of a configured_effectivity_assignment or it shall have an id of 'class usage' and be the of an applied_effectivity_assignment which has a in its set of items.

An that is not a or a , shall either be used at least once as the by an with a name of 'inheritance', or it shall have an id of 'configuration validity' and be the of a configured_effectivity_assignment or it shall have an id of 'class usage' and be the of an applied_effectivity_assignment which has a product_concept_feature_category_usage in its set of items.
The restrict_externally_defined_item_relationship rule ensures the correct correlation between the name of an and the related instances.
If an has a name of 'name scope', the shall be of type externally_defined_general_property and shall reference as the source a and the shall be of type and shall reference as its source a .
The restrict_external_identification_assignment rule constrains instances of applied_external_identification_assignment according to their role name.
If the role has a name of 'alternative document id and location', only items of type document_file shall be in the set of items.
If the role has a name of 'version', only items of type externally_defined_class, or externally_defined_general_property shall be in the set of items.
The restrict_group_assignment rule constrains instances of applied_group_assignment according to their role name.
If the role has a name of 'group membership', only items of type or shall be in the set of items.
If the role has a name of 'group membership', the set of items shall include either objects of type or .

The restrict_organization_assignment rule constrains the instances of applied_organization_assignment.
If the role has a name of 'organization in contract', only items of type shall be in the set of items.
If the role has a name of 'signing for contract', only items of type applied_organization_assignment shall be in the set of items.
If the role has a name of 'validity context', only items of type shall be in the set of items.
If the role has a name of 'alias scope', only items of type shall be in the set of items.
The restrict_person_and_organization_assignment rule constrains the instances of applied_organization_assignment.
If the role has a name of 'signing for contract', only items of type applied_organization_assignment shall be in the set of items.

The restrict_product_categories_for_tool_part_relationship rule constrains instances of as follows: for each instance of that has a name of 'tool part relationship', the used as the shall be associated to a referencing a product that is referenced by a with a name of 'tool'. The used as the shall be associated to a referencing a product that is referenced by a with a name of 'part'.

For each instance of that has a name of 'tool part relationship', the used as the shall be associated to a referencing a product that is referenced by a with a name of 'tool'. The used as the shall be associated to a referencing a product that is referenced by a with a name of 'part'.

The restrict_product_category_for_product rule enforces the existence of a with a name of either 'part', 'raw material', 'tool', 'document', 'functionality', 'conceptual product, 'alternative solution', 'requirement' for each product.
Each instance of product shall be referenced by a with a name of either 'part', 'raw material', 'tool', 'document', 'functionality', 'conceptual product', 'alternative solution', 'requirement'.

The restrict_product_definition_context_for_external_properties rule specifies that a which is referrenced as the by a which itself is refrerenced as the by a that references as the an externally_defined_general_property, shall be referenced as the definition by a which has as the a with a name of 'external' and which references as its role a with a name of 'external'.

Each instance of which is referrenced as the by a which itself is refrerenced as the by a that references as the an externally_defined_general_property, shall be referenced as the definition by a which has as the a with a name of 'external' and which references as its role a with a name of 'external'.
The restrict_product_definition_context_for_product rule ensures the correct correlation between the name of the which is referenced as the by a and the of the associated product.

If the references as its a with a name of 'functional definition', this shall reference as its formation a which references as a product which is in the set of products of a with a name of 'functionality'.

If the references as its a with a name of 'conceptual definition', this shall reference as its formation a which references as a product which is in the set of products of a with a name of 'conceptual product'.

If the references as its a with a name of 'physical document definition', 'digital document definition', or 'physical model occurrence', this shall reference as its formation a which references as a product which is in the set of products of a with a name of 'document'.
The restrict_product_definition_substitute rule specifies the restrictions that apply to the usage of .
For each instance of there shall be at least one instance of applied_effectivity_assignment that contains the instance in its set of items.
Each instance of shall reference as a which references as a with a name of 'part occurrence'.
Each instance of shall reference as an which is referenced as by a , or shall reference as a with a which references as its a with a name of 'part occurrence'.
The restrict_product_definitions_for_product_definition_relationship rule ensures the correct correlation between the name or type of the and the of the related product definitions.
If the is of type , the and the shall either both reference as their a with a name of 'part definition', or shall both reference as their a with a name of 'physical occurrence'.
If the has a name of 'physical realization', the shall reference as its a with a name of 'part definition', and the shall reference as its a with a name of 'physical occurrence'.
If the has a name of 'physical occurrence usage', it shall be of type and both the and the shall reference as a with a name of 'physical occurrence' .
The restrict_properties_of_document_file rule specifies the restrictions that apply for properties of digital files.
Each instance of shall be referenced as definition by at most one with a name of 'document property'.
Each instance of shall reference as an instance of with a name of either 'digital', or 'physical'.
The restrict_properties_of_document_representation rule specifies the restrictions that apply for properties of document representations.

Each instance of that references as a with a name of either 'physical document definition', 'digital document definition', or 'physical model occurrence' shall be referenced as definition by at most one with a name of 'document property'.
The restrict_representation_for_document_content_property rule specifies the restrictions that apply for representations with a name of 'document content'.
For each instance of which has a name of 'document content' there shall be at least one and at most three instances of instances in the set of items.
Each instance of that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document content' shall have a name of either 'detail level', 'geometry type', or 'real world scale'.
There shall be at most one instance of that have a name of 'detail level' and which is of type that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document content'.
There shall be at most one instance of that have a name of 'geometry type' and which is of type that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document content'.
There shall be at most one instance of that have a name of 'real world scale' and which is either of type , or that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document content'.
The restrict_representation_for_document_creation_property rule specifies the restrictions that apply for representations with a name of 'document creation'.
For each instance of which has a name of 'document creation' there shall be at least one and at most three instances of instances in the set of items.
Each instance of that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document creation' shall have a name of either 'creating interface', 'creating system', or 'operating system'.
There shall be at most one instance of that have a name of 'creating interface' and which is of type that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document creation'.
There shall be exactly one instance of that have a name of 'creating system' and which is of type that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document creation'.
There shall be at most one instance of that have a name of 'operating system' and which is of type that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document creation'.
The restrict_representation_for_document_format_property rule specifies the restrictions that apply for representations with a name of 'document format'.
For each instance of which has a name of 'document format' there shall be at least one and at most three instances of instances in the set of items.
Each instance of that is referenced as items by an instance of with a name of 'document format' shall have a name of either 'character code', or 'data format'.

The at_most_one_class_system function evaluates for an instance of any type if there is more than one with role name 'class system membership'. If there is more than one of such of , the function returns FALSE.

The item_correlation function accepts a set of GENERIC and a set of STRING as input and returns a boolean result.
The function will return TRUE if all elements of the first set are in the set of types that is generated from the second set. Else it will return FALSE.
the set of instances that is considered.

The allowed_translations function checks for an instance if language indication and translations are provided correctly and for the right attributes. In that case, it returns TRUE else it returns FALSE.
